DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Target Tumor Mass Visual Pathway Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication as to whether or not the patient has a target tumor in the visual pathway.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Target Tumor Mass Visual Pathway
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._A set of neural connections within the central nervous system, beginning with the retina and terminating in the occipital cortex, that provides the ability to process visual images.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.:A set of neural connections within the central nervous system, beginning with the retina and terminating in the occipital cortex, that provides the ability to process visual images.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.
A set of neural connections within the central nervous system, beginning with the retina and terminating in the occipital cortex, that provides the ability to process visual images.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
